alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lee; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Fairfield, Lee, northeastern Clarendon, Sumter, northeastern Richland and Kershaw Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sesquicentennial State Park to 9 miles southwest of Hebron. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Camden, Bishopville, South Sumter, Shaw Air Base, Lake Wateree Dam, Dentsville, Lugoff, Oakland, Liberty Hill, Mulberry, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, Villages at Sandhill, Woods Bay State Park, Cassatt, Elliott, Elgin and Killian. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 77 and 126. Interstate 77 between mile markers 18 and 31. Interstate 95 between mile markers 126 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Clarendon; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lee; Richland; Sumter
